result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont O Lovett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges by 06-30-2015. If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamont O Lovett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: vacate judgment for $10.00 atty fees was not to be set up as a payment plan.  vp
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $441.00 entered as ordered by the court on 05/14/15 to pay $70.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 02/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs, signed, filed and distributed. cmt

Defendant Lamont O Lovett in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by parties. 
As to Count 1:    Court sentences defendant to serve 3 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 06-30-2015.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.

Defendant Lamont O Lovett in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-04-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamont O Lovett in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant's petition for appointment of counsel GRANTED by the court.  Court appointed Attorney Kevin Dunn as counsel of record at a rate of $70.00 per hour.  Written order received and filed.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 46. jks  Status conference scheduled for 03-20-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or  no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  
DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Lamont O Lovett in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  
Defendant Lamont O Lovett in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  
Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  
Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Branch 46.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
